titleStmt.title: Johann Pete Spisherman et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5377

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette

We the undersigned citizens of Louisville and neighbors of William Brockman recently sentenced to ten years confinement in the penetentiary for the murder of Adam Adolphe, by the Jefferson Circuit Court, learning that the counsel for the accused were about to petition your Excellency for his pardon would respectfully represent that the accused is a man of bad character and of notoriously violent disposition, that his punishment in this case is milder than he had any reason to expect

Johann Peter Spisherman
